Welcome to Companies API’s documentation!¶

class companies.businessdataservice.BusinessDataService¶

Class for fetching data from api endpoint and storing it to local db.

create_address(company, address, *argv)¶

Creates a new Address object.

Params company

Company to which the data is related to. This is used as the foreign key for the data.

Params address

dictionary that contains the new address

Params argv

This is for method signature compatibility with create_db_object

create_db_object(company, data, class_name, data_label, type_label)¶

Creates a new model object.

Params company

Company to which the data is related to. This is used as the foreign key for the data.

Params data

dictionary that contains the new data

Params class_name

The name of the model class to instantiate

Params data_label

The label for the data in the dictionary

Params type_label

The label for the data type in the dictionary

form_response_from_db(business_id)¶

Forms the API JSON response based on the data in database.

: params business_id: The business id of the company whose data to get.

get_address_from_db(company, addr_in_json, *argv)¶

Returns an Address object from the database. :params company: Company to which the address is related to :params addr_in_json: dictionary that contains the address data to search for :params argv: This is just for method signature compatibility with get_data_from_db

get_business_id()¶

Returns the business id if get_results has been called and business id was found from JSON data

get_company_from_db(business_id)¶
Get company object from db. Creates a new company if a

company with the given business id is does not exist.

Parameters

business_id – Business id of the company to search for

get_data_from_db(company, data, class_name, data_label, type_label)¶

Returns a data model object from the database. :params company: Company to which the data is related to :params addr_in_json: dictionary that contains the data to search for :params class_name: The name of the model class to use in search :params data_label: The label for the data in the dictionary :params type_label: The label for the data type in the dictionary

get_name()¶

Returns the company name if get_results has been called and business name was found from JSON data

get_result()¶

Returns the result array that contains the name, address and other relevant data

get_results(company_id)¶

Gets results from the api endpoint and stores the result JSON in class property

is_valid(data)¶

Returns true if the data has no end date.

number_of_results()¶

Returns the number of results if get_results has been called and there are results

save_data_to_db(array_label, type_label, accepted_data_types, data_label, class_name, company, get_data_from_db=None, create_db_object=None)¶

Examines a certain subset of JSON result and stores data to db (SQLite3)

Parameters

  • array_label – The name of the subset in JSON to examine e.g. “names”

  • type_label – Label for the accepted type, e.g. order

  • accepted_data_types_label – List of accepted data types, e.g. [0]

  • data_label – Label of the data that should be selected, e.g. “name”

  • class_name – Class name of the model for the data in db

  • company – Company object that data is related to

  • get_data_from_db – Function for getting data from db to see if data already exists in db. If this parameter is omitted, the data model needs to be a subclass of CompanyData with an additional property called “value”.

  • create_db_object – Function for creating a new data model object. If this parameter is omitted, the data model needs to be a subclass of CompanyData with an additional property called “value”.

class companies.validator.Validator¶

Class for validating a company id.

classmethod is_valid_company_id(company_id)¶

Validates the given company_id. Returns True if the id is valid, False otherwise. :param company_id: The company id to validate.
